name: Cashew Cheese Cannelloni
name_origin: Cannelloni is Italian for 'large reeds', describing the tube-shaped pasta. This vegan version uses cashew-based ricotta.
description: Pasta tubes filled with creamy cashew cheese and spinach, baked in a rich tomato sauce until golden and bubbly.
cultural_context: A modern plant-based adaptation of the Italian classic, bringing the comfort of baked pasta to the kosher pareve table.
vegan_adaptation_notes: Cashews replace ricotta cheese. Nutritional yeast adds cheesy umami flavor.
intro_paragraph: Cannelloni means 'large reeds' in Italian, describing these tube-shaped pasta. This vegan version fills them with a creamy cashew cheese blended with wilted spinach, then bakes them in a herb-infused tomato sauce until golden and bubbling.
steps: Drain soaked cashews. Blend with lemon juice, nutritional yeast, salt, pepper, olive oil, and water until smooth and creamy.
Wilt spinach in a pan, squeeze out excess water, chop finely. Mix with cashew cheese.
Prepare tomato sauce: simmer passata with garlic, basil, paprika, salt and pepper for 10 minutes.
Stuff cannelloni tubes with the cashew-spinach filling using a piping bag or spoon.
Spread half the sauce in a baking dish. Arrange stuffed cannelloni in a single layer. Cover with remaining sauce.
Cover with foil and bake at 180°C for 30 minutes. Remove foil and bake 15 more minutes until golden and bubbling.
Let rest 5 minutes before serving. Garnish with fresh basil.
